Take advantage of superior connectivity: 10 minutes to Downtown Vegas, 11 to the Las Vegas Strip, 22 to Harry Reid Int'l Airport, and 25 to Henderson.

brokerDetails.name: Frank Volk
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializes in Large-Scale Mixed-Use Projects
brokerDetails.bio:
Frank Volk is an Executive Vice President with CBRE specializing in large-scale mixed-use projects within the Las Vegas market. Frank has over 20 years of impressive experience in the local retail market, focused on highly sought after tourist destinations within the hospitality and gaming industries. Frank is recognized as an expert in his field, completing transactions in excess of $1.5 billion over the course of his career. His unique client-centric approach and extensive knowledge of the niche Las Vegas tourist market allows him to provide his clients with unparalleled market intelligence to make informed decisions. Frank provides insights into how consumers interact with commercial real estate and is a trusted advisor to some of the most iconic developments in the area.

Prior to joining CBRE Frank was a managing principal with SRS, where he established its Las Vegas office and specialized in marketing and leasing retail projects associated with the hospitality and gaming industries.

brokerDetails.name: Brad Peterson, SIOR
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in Office Space
brokerDetails.bio:
Mr. Peterson has been involved in more office lease transactions than anyone in Nevada’s commercial real estate history. Mr. Peterson has completed Nevada’s top three largest office lease transactions: representing MGM Resorts for a total of 230,000 square feet and Aristocrat Gaming for a total of 180,000 square feet and represented Bechtel SAIC Corporation in a lease for approximately 308,000 square feet. Other past significant transactions include a 109,000 square foot lease for Zappos.com. He also participated in many sales transactions, one of which was the recent JMA disposition consisting of 6 of their buildings, totalling approximately 164,026 square feet for a combined price of $114,500,000.

Mr. Peterson has been one of the city’s top office brokers for over 30 years and has been a top 5 producer in the Las Vegas office for most of his career. He has been selected by his peers to receive the CB Richard Ellis Quality of Excellence Award. Mr. Peterson has lead a team of up to seven real estate professionals who together leased and sold more than 6 million square feet of office space in the last five years. Mr. Peterson is an active member of the Southern Nevada Chapter of the National Association of Industrial and Office Parks (NAIOP) and the Society of Industrial and Office Realtors (SIOR). He received the award for “Top Producer of the SIOR Nevada Chapter” five years in a row. In 2007, 2008, 2009, and 2014, Mr. Peterson and his team were honored with the “Office Broker of the Year” award by NAIOP. In 2014, Mr. Peterson was honored as one of the top 250 earners for CBRE worldwide. He also co-chaired Save our Sports, an organization of community leaders raising money for middle school athletics, is on the Board of a non-profit organization, Family and Child Treatment (FACT), and has served on the Advisory Board for City National Bank for the past ten years. Mr. Peterson continues to lease the most office lease transactions every year in the Southern Nevada market.

brokerDetails.name: Justin Witt
brokerDetails.tagLine: Vice President - Advisory & Transaction Services
brokerDetails.bio:
Justin Witt is a Senior Associate with CBRE’s Advisory and Transaction Services specializing in office properties in Las Vegas, NV. His team advises office tenants on complex real estate transactions such as headquarter relocations, renewals, expansions, and build-to-suit leases. During his career, Justin has established a reputation for delivering client-oriented results through cost savings and creating competitive advantage with strategic office locations. His intimate knowledge of Las Vegas trends and historical real estate patterns ensures his clients can make informed decisions. Responsiveness, attention to detail, and proactively pursuing opportunities has allowed Justin to become a trusted advisor.

Justin and his team represent a range of clients that includes local businesses and Fortune 500 companies. They have been involved in many of the largest office lease transactions in Las Vegas, including Aristocrat Gaming (160,000 SF), Rocky Mountain Hospital (107,257 SF), Telus (104,320 SF), and Anthem (80,689 SF). His team has also transacted several notable sales, including the Orthopedic Specialty Hospital of Nevada (84,000 SF) and NBC Universal’s purchase of new broadcasting space (29,000 SF).

Prior to joining CBRE, Justin’s entrepreneurial drive led him to become a founding member of a startup electronics brand based in Vista, California. From there he pivoted to the entertainment industry where he worked with independent record labels and artist management firms headquartered in Southern California.

address: 4145 Wagon Trail Ave20,607 SF Industrial
description:
4145 Wagon Trail Avenue presents a blank canvas opportunity situated in the hot Southwest industrial market of Las Vegas.
 
This turnkey, vacant industrial facility spans an impressive 20,607 square feet across two stories, offering buyers a wide range of possibilities. Built in 2003 and upgraded with a full permitted mezzanine, heavy power, and heavy HVAC capacity in 2018, the property features a clean concrete façade and a strong list of industrial-grade amenities. Wagon Trail is equipped with 2,500 amps of heavy power at 480 volts (via 1500KVA transformer) plus 1,500 amps at 208/120 volts (via 750KVA transformer) over 180 tons of HVAC capacity, a full commercial production kitchen, and a secure, fenced yard. Situated on 0.57 acres, there’s ample outdoor space for storage and parking. Delivered vacant, the property allows buyers to immediately bring their vision to life. It benefits from broad IL (Industrial-Light) zoning (unincorporated Clark County), which permits uses such as warehousing, light manufacturing, assembly, storage, distribution, flex industrial spaces, and certain service uses. This zoning flexibility also opens the door to more specialized uses, including potential data center conversion, high-tech operations, heavy power process manufacturing, or USDA-certifiable food production. With robust infrastructure and versatile zoning, this asset presents a rare opportunity for industrial users or investors seeking a ready-to-go facility with room to grow. The ability to remove all or part of the mezzanine has been quantified and estimates are available.
 
This location within the Las Vegas metro is ideal for industrial users. Opportunity for capital appreciation is high in this submarket due to the rapid development and increasingly scarce land availability in recent years. The property is minutes from Harry Reid Airport and Interstate 15, which bodes well for businesses in need of efficiency for logistics. The Switch Superloop data center facility is also approximately one mile away, as well as several other big-name industrial facilities, creating top-notch area synergy. Many retailers, restaurants, and conveniences are also within a quick drive.
 
The Las Vegas market is also an ideal place for investment, seeing as it is one of the most dynamic metropolitan areas in the Southwestern United States. The area performs well across many sectors, including leisure and hospitality, construction, trade, transportation, utilities, healthcare, and education. The city is well-positioned for continued growth. 
 
Property tours are available by appointment only. Please contact the listing broker to schedule.

address: 5321 Cameron St20,980 SF Retail
description:
Entertainment Complex, Commercial Kitchen, Extensive Cold Storage, and Warehousing. 5321 Cameron Street is a commercial/industrial property in Southwest Las Vegas that offers a rare and versatile opportunity for investors, entertainment professionals, and culinary entrepreneurs. Situated on a 1.2-acre lot in the highly sought-after Southwest industrial corridor, this recently renovated 20,980-square-foot facility is strategically located near the Las Vegas Strip, Allegiant Stadium, and the Las Vegas Freeway, making it ideal for high-traffic operations. 5321 Cameron Street boasts a unique combination of licenses rarely found outside major casinos, including a full bar, live entertainment, banquets, catering, and outdoor dining licenses. The property is fully equipped to support a wide range of uses, including live events, film and media production, catering, and warehousing. These valuable assets enhance the property's appeal as a premier venue for concerts, weddings, film premieres, esports tournaments, charity galas, and private parties. 
  
The event center spans 9,524 square feet indoors and an additional 1,600 square feet of sound-wired outdoor space. It can accommodate up to 606 guests and offers 124 on-site parking spaces with ample overflow capacity. A modular 24-foot by 16-foot stage, 33-foot programmable LED bar, three video walls, 40 mounted TVs, and three portable outdoor TVs provide a high-tech environment for immersive experiences. Internet connectivity is robust, with symmetrical speeds of 500 Mbps, upgradeable to 2 Gbps. A 90-camera Hikvision surveillance system, featuring 24 terabytes of storage, ensures comprehensive security. 
  
5321 Cameron Street features a pristine industrial-grade kitchen that spans 3,883 square feet and is commissary-approved. It features a 30-foot Ansul fire suppression hood, three walk-in coolers, two of which are forklift accessible, and two freezers, allowing for ample cold storage. This space is ideal for large-scale food production, off-site catering, food truck prep, and pop-up culinary events. Additional features include 5,771 square feet of racked warehouse space with a 960-square-foot mezzanine, forklift access, and industrial-grade utilities for equipment storage, logistics, and fulfillment operations. The administrative wing offers 617 square feet of office space across three private offices, a break room, a surveillance room, and a 225-square-foot utility room, all wired and Wi-Fi-ready to support business operations and tenant flexibility.
  
This property represents a compelling investment opportunity in a rapidly growing market. Its rare licensing, advanced infrastructure, and strategic location make it an ideal solution for entertainment companies, production studios, catering businesses, and event planners seeking a fully operational, multi-use facility. The sale includes a comprehensive package of furniture, fixtures, and equipment, offering immediate usability and long-term value in one of Las Vegas’ most dynamic commercial zones.

brokerDetails.name: Jeff Susa
brokerDetails.tagLine: A real estate expert with over 42 years of experience.
brokerDetails.bio: A real estate expert for over 42 years, Jeff Susa began his real estate career in 1979. Just two years later, in 1981, he became one of the youngest brokers to hold a license in the state of California. He began syndicating properties to acquire apartments and small commercial properties in the San Fernando Valley and naturally expanded into building larger shopping centers and multi-story office buildings in addition to his work in syndication. In 1986, Jeff made the move to Las Vegas where he continued to expand his career and hone his expertise, focusing on syndicating, building properties and undertaking larger scale projects, including shopping centers, mini-storage facilities, apartments, single-family homes and office buildings. A visionary in his field, Jeff has also participated in the design of several award-winning properties. Jeff is experienced in all aspects of commercial development, from the negotiations and acquisitions of land purchases to the construction and completion of a final product. Utilizing his extensive management knowledge, Jeff has supervised the development and management of more than $1.2 billion dollars’ worth of retail, office, residential and multi-family space in Nevada and California. The hallmark of an expert businessman committed to displaying the highest level of integrity, Jeff focuses on long-term investor relationships, the result of which has led to his involvement in numerous multi-million-dollar transactions. In his spare time, Jeff enjoys spending time with his wife and two grown children as well as traveling, flying and golfing. Giving back to his community has always been a primary focus for Jeff, who also served as the Co-chairman of the National Kidney Foundation golf tournament for numerous years.

brokerDetails.name: Tanner Susa
brokerDetails.tagLine: Tanner Susa is a broker salesperson and Director of Marketing at Real Estate Asset Management.
brokerDetails.bio:
With a decade of experience in the commercial real estate industry, Tanner Susa has been exposed to myriad aspects of commercial real estate from a young age. As a Broker-Salesperson, Tanner’s clients are his top priority. He is involved in Real Estate Asset Management’s leasing, sales, and management equaling multi-million dollars worth of transactions as well as in tenant representation for all types of commercial real estate. As the Director of Marketing for RAM, Tanner is dedicated to leading the company into the digital age with intuitive marketing.

A retail specialist licensed in the state of Nevada and California, Tanner holds a Nevada property management permit and has extensive knowledge of a variety of real estate subjects. He is a graduate of Chapman University with a B.A. in Communications and a minor in History.

Away from the office, Tanner enjoys all forms of physical activity, traveling, being outdoors, reading, and charity work.

brokerDetails.name: Gabe Telles
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in Industrial Brokerage
brokerDetails.bio: Gabe Telles, Vice President, was born and raised in Las Vegas and brings over 2 decades of experience in Industrial Brokerage.  He specializes in Industrial Landlord and Tenant Representation, along with Land and Investment services at Colliers.

brokerDetails.name: Pat Marsh, SIOR
brokerDetails.tagLine: Executive Vice President - Industrial Division at Colliers
brokerDetails.bio:
Pat Marsh, SIOR has been involved in industrial real estate in Las Vegas since 1996. He began with CB Richard Ellis where he specialized in tenant and landlord representation. In 1998, when Colliers established a presence in Southern Nevada, Pat left the CB office to work for Colliers. With over 25 years of experience, Pat is a seasoned Broker in Southern Nevada and has been one of the top producers in the Las Vegas office for over a decade. During his tenure, Pat has completed over 1,000 industrial transactions with a total consideration in excess of $1.25 billion, including $485 million in transactions over the past 24 months.

Pat Marsh and Sam Newman have been partnered since 2010 and have a combined experience of 40+ years marketing industrial real estate properties in Southern Nevada. Some of their representative clients include Panattoni Development Company, Prologis, Trammell Crow Company, Washington Capital, EJM Development Co., Weingarten Realty, Apex Industrial Park, Freeman, Scientific Games Corporation, Cort Furniture, Sord supply chain logistics, Quiet Logistics, Main Electric Supply, and Coca Cola.

brokerDetails.name: Charlie Newman
brokerDetails.tagLine: Brokerage Specialist at Colliers

brokerDetails.name: Sam Newman, SIOR
brokerDetails.tagLine: Vice President at Colliers
brokerDetails.bio:
Sam Newman, SIOR is a Vice President, specializing in Industrial & Logistics. Since Joining Colliers in 2010, Sam has been involved in over 750 industrial transactions with a total consideration in excess of $1.5 Billion, including $200 million of transactions over the past 18 months. During his tenure, Sam has accumulated a vast knowledge of all phases of industrial site selection, design and development, acquisition, stabilization and disposition, along with general leasing and sales.
Sam has been partnered with Pat Marsh, SIOR since his start at Colliers. Together, they currently list over 4.5 million square feet of industrial property in the Las Vegas Valley and have represented some of the top corporations in Southern Nevada. Representative clients have included Panattoni Development Company, Freeman Company, Prologis, Scientific Games Corporation, Rousso Investments, Wal-Mart Stores, Inc., MGM Resorts, EJM Development, Apex Industrial Park, NV Energy, Las Vegas Paving Co., Harsch Investment Properties, and CenturyLink / Embarq.

spaces.name: 110 W Gowan Rd
spaces.description:
Desert Willow Logistics Center – Building B is a ±505,466-square-foot, Class A industrial development located at 110 W Gowan Rd, North Las Vegas, NV. Designed to accommodate a wide range of user needs, the facility offers divisibility options, 40' clear height, and a cross-dock loading configuration featuring 112 dock-high doors and 4 drive-in doors. Additional specifications include LED lighting, 8-inch floor slab, and up to 3,250 amps of 277/480-volt, 3-phase heavy power. The truck court depth ranges from 135' to 185', and the property supports efficient logistics operations with 78 dedicated trailer parking stalls.

Strategically positioned in the highly sought-after North Las Vegas submarket, the property sits at the northeast corner of N Commerce St and W Gowan Rd, offering immediate access to I-15 via the Cheyenne Avenue interchange. It is surrounded by abundant amenities and a strong base of quality tenants. Just 9.5 miles from the Las Vegas Strip and 13.5 miles from Harry Reid International Airport, the location offers exceptional connectivity to key business and transportation hubs.

brokerDetails.name: Rob Lujan
brokerDetails.tagLine: Executive Managing Director, Industrial & Logistics, SIOR, CCIM
brokerDetails.bio:
Rob Lujan continues his 25 year career at JLL, where he provides expertise to industrial developers, buyers, landlords and tenants. He  handles agency and tenant rep leasing assignments as well as helps clients with acquisition and disposition of investments, and land acquisition and new spec industrial development projects.

As Senior Managing Director of Logistics and Industrial Services at JLL’s Las Vegas office, Rob’s Las Vegas market knowledge and depth of experience allows him to serve clients in a multitude of industrial asset services including agency and tenant representation leasing, site selection and acquisition, build to suit development, and acquisition and disposition of investment properties.

Over his career Rob has completed thousands of transactions, representing hundreds of clients on millions of square feet of properties leased, purchased or sold with total value in excess of $500 million.

brokerDetails.name: Danny Leanos
brokerDetails.tagLine: Senior Associate at JLL
brokerDetails.bio:
As a member of JLL's top-ranked Las Vegas Industrial Services team, I bring specialized expertise to the dynamic commercial real estate market of Southern Nevada. Our team, led by Rob Lujan, SIOR, CCIM and Jason Simon, SIOR, boasts an impressive track record with 46 years of combined experience and over $2.4 billion in total transaction volume.

Together, we've completed 585 transactions, representing 23.4 million square feet of industrial space and 944 acres of land. 

Our comprehensive services include agency leasing, tenant representation, owner/user building sales, land sales, build-to-suit site selection, and investment sales. We pride ourselves on our deep market knowledge, strong relationships with developers, landlords, and brokers across Las Vegas and the U.S., and our unparalleled commitment to uncovering opportunities for our clients.
As part of this dynamic and hungry team, I contribute to our market-leading track record with unmatched energy and dedication. Whether you're a tenant seeking the perfect industrial space or a landlord looking for expert representation, our team at JLL Las Vegas is equipped to meet your commercial real estate needs with precision and professionalism.
Let's connect to discuss how our team's expertise can drive your success in the Las Vegas industrial real estate market.

brokerDetails.name: Amy Lance
brokerDetails.bio:
Amy Lance is a Director at Cushman & Wakefield, has more than 20 years of industry experience and specializes in the representation of owner/landlords and tenant/buyers relating to the leasing and sales of commercial properties. 

Prior to joining Cushman & Wakefield, Amy was a Vice President on the Las Vegas Office Team at CBRE where Amy had the pleasure of representing some of the Las Vegas valley’s most notable Class A, Mixed Use and single story flex developments including the One Summerlin, Downtown Summerlin, Two Summerlin, 1700 Pavilion, The Canyons and Plazas at Summerlin, The Gramercy, The Park at Spanish Ridge, Rainbow Sunset Pavilion, AXIOM, Marnell Corporate Center, Green Valley Corporate Center North & South, The District and The HC. 

Additionally, Amy is dedicated to building long-lasting relationships, making it a top priority to fully understand the business goals and needs of her clients. As a result she is able to help maximize their profits, anticipate and solve problems, and stay on the cutting edge of all matters related to the real estate process.

brokerDetails.name: Courtney Lance
brokerDetails.bio:
Courtney Lance embarked on her journey with Cushman & Wakefield in 2021, taking on the role of Brokerage Specialist. Prior to this, she served as a Client Services Assistant on the Las Vegas Office Team at CBRE for a notable two-year period.
Equipped with a diverse skill set encompassing marketing, design, photography, videography and organizational prowess, Courtney is committed to expanding her industry knowledge to better assist her team. Beyond her defined responsibilities, she actively seeks opportunities to contribute more effectively, leveraging her role as a licensee to integrate market insights and strengths into each assignment.
Courtney takes pride in her strong work ethic, making it a top priority to thoroughly understand the business goals of both her clients and team. This unwavering commitment positions her as a valuable asset, ensuring that she not only meets but surpasses the expectations placed upon her.

brokerDetails.name: Barton Hyde
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in Health Care Sales & Leasing and Office
brokerDetails.bio:
Barton Hyde joined Avison Young in August of 2012 as a Principal, Office Group.  With 20 years of commercial real estate experience in Las Vegas, Barton specializes in the sales and leasing of professional and medical office space focusing on new business development, financial analysis, consultations and managing client relations. Prior to joining Avison Young, Barton was a Vice President at Newmark Grubb Knight Frank for over 13 years.

Barton is intimately familiar with the local commercial real estate market, having been a resident of Las Vegas since 1975. He is one of the leading professionals in commercial real estate and represents national and local clients as well as some of the largest and most prestigious properties in Las Vegas.

Barton has established relationships with a large variety of businesses, doctors and practices across the Greater Las Vegas area and serves his clients by providing up-to-date experienced transaction expertise and extensive market knowledge. Barton continues to assist his clients in procuring the best lease and purchase options available under the most challenging market conditions in the valley.

brokerDetails.name: Hillary Steinberg
brokerDetails.tagLine: Retail, Landlord Representation, Tenant Representation and Investment Sales
brokerDetails.bio:
Hillary Steinberg joined Avison Young in July 2022 as Vice President - Retail, specializing in Landlord Representation, Tenant Representation, and Investment Sales with a focus on multi-tenant shopping centers and single net tenant assets throughout Las Vegas, North Las Vegas and Henderson.

Hillary began her career at Homart Development Company, a subsidiary of Sears, one of the largest builders of shopping centers in the United States, purchased by General Growth Properties in 1994. Her property portfolio included regional shopping centers, high-rise office buildings and ground-up development. Most recently, Hillary was a Senior Advisor for MDL Group in Las Vegas with a portfolio of over 1 million square feet of rentable area.

brokerDetails.name: Corina Towle
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in Retail/Restaurant
brokerDetails.bio: Corina Towle began her career in commercial real estate in 2019 at MDL Group. She joined Hillary Steinberg to become the Steinberg Towle Team. Corina specializes in landlord/tenant rep in retail. Notable leases include 9th Island Kava, Kraken Café, and Gray’s Banana Pudding. She is currently the Co-Chair of the Events Committee for Vegas Young Professionals: an organization through the Las Vegas Chamber of Commerce dedicated to identifying, engaging, developing, and connecting future leaders. -Prior to entering CRE (2011-2019), Corina worked as a Registered Behavior Technician for children with Autism in San Diego. She graduated from UNR with a BA degree in Psychology with concentrations on Politics, Ethics, and Law.

address: 5765 W Sunset Rd33,543 SF Industrial
description:
Positioned in the heart of the booming Southwest Las Vegas submarket, Sunset & Jones at 5765 W Sunset Road features a newly constructed, state-of-the-art Class A industrial building offering unmatched design, functionality, and exposure. With commanding Sunset Road frontage, exceptional street visibility, and signage opportunities to maximize brand exposure, the property is ideal for businesses seeking a prominent presence in a high-traffic corridor. 
       
Boasting 33,543 total square feet, the building offers efficient layout options tailored for modern industrial users, including warehousing, manufacturing, distribution, or last-mile logistics, among other uses. The expansive facility's serviced dock and grade-level loading, heavy electrical service, 26-foot clear height, TPO membrane roofing with R38 insulation, ESFR sprinkler system, concrete mezzanine area, and much more, signify the attention to detail and possible accommodations. 
     
Sunset & Jones benefits from a strategic location surrounded by established corporate neighbors and key Las Vegas infrastructure. Situated just minutes from the Las Vegas Strip, Harry Reid International Airport, and Downtown Las Vegas, the industrial property offers immediate freeway accessibility. The area is also home to a robust mix of national retailers, service stations, and distribution centers, offering a dynamic environment for business growth and synergy. 
      
As one of the few new Class A industrial offerings in the supply-constrained and highly competitive submarket, this asset presents a rare opportunity for businesses looking to establish or expand their footprint in one of Las Vegas’ most desirable industrial corridors.

brokerDetails.name: Jakke Farley
brokerDetails.bio:
Jakke Farley is a well-rounded agent with over fifteen years of Commercial Real Estate Experience. She has a proven track record throughout the Las Vegas Valley and surrounding areas.

Jakke specializes in Shopping Center Leasing, Landlord Representation for office and retail centers, and Tenant representation for Mom&Pops, regionals, and national clients, and has helped several schools lease or buy locations throughout Las Vegas.

Her most notable clients are Popeye’s Lousiana Kitchen, Handel’s Home-Made Ice Cream, Fiiz, and Sayulitas Mexican Food, just to name a few. In addition, Jakke has exclusive representation for over half a million square feet throughout Clark County.

As a Las Vegas local, she understands Vegas and the surrounding area well and can help her clients fill their needs no matter how complex.

brokerDetails.name: Jeff Mitchell
brokerDetails.tagLine: Retail Sales and Leasing, Tenant Representation
brokerDetails.bio:
A relentless pursuit of peak performance is engrained in Jeff’s DNA. Jeff is able to provide solutions for clients throughout the intermountain states, as the Principal Broker of the Mountain West Commercial office, he directs the growth of Mountain West’s unparalleled retail platform in the Nevada Market. Jeff blends the best of all worlds – business acumen, drive and educational insight – to deliver winning solutions for clients in the areas of tenant representation and consulting; landlord/developer representation and consulting; and all aspect of retail shopping center investments and land sales. Jeff’s financial and analytical skills enable him to break down the many complexities of a real estate transaction to ensure the client’s best interest is met. From some of the biggest names in the retail and restaurant industry to local mom and pop retailers, Jeff executes every deal with precision.
Jeff's areas of focus encompass: retail/restaurant tenant representation and consulting, landlord/developer representation and consulting, retail shopping center investment and land sales. Jeff has had the opportunity to work in representing such Tenants as 7-11, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co, Burlington Stores, Corner Bakery Café, Domino’s, Donut Bar, Firehouse Subs, Fleming's Restaurant Group, Floyd’s 99, Goodyear, Nacho Daddy, Natural Grocers, Mars Retail Group, Griddlecakes, Skechers, Verizon, Vitamin Shoppe, Wal-Mart, SkinnyFats.  Landlords include, Amsource, Bekam Development, CNA Enterprises, Barings, Cornerstone Capital, Vestar, The Eagle Group, Excel Trust (ShopCore), Inland, Oro Capital, RPAI and Woodbury.  Whether competing with his championship cycling team or developing solutions for complex real estate deals, Jeff knows success requires tenacity and perseverance and that it is often a team effort. Individual excellence can never outpace the momentum of a team moving with passion and purpose, collaboration is critical. Jeff aspires to make his teammates and industry better through mentorship and membership. He is an active member of the International Council of Shopping Centers (ICSC), a designated Certified Leasing Specialist (CLS) and a Director for the CCIM Institute Southern Nevada Chapter. Jeff holds real estate licenses in Utah and Nevada.

brokerDetails.name: Ian Davis
brokerDetails.tagLine: Real Estate Agent at Mountain West Commercial Real Estate
brokerDetails.bio:
Ian Davis began his career in commercial real estate at Mountain West Commercial Real Estate (MWCRE) in 2018. He works in MWCRE’s Nevada office under the guidance of Principal Broker Jeff Mitchell. Ian is a meticulous broker who pays close attention to every transaction detail, from start to finish, to achieve the best possible outcome for his clients. Due to his on-the-job training & market research, he has gained in-depth market knowledge, excellent communication skills, and a drive to be the best in his field.

Ian specializes in Tenant Representation & Consulting, Landlord & Developer Representation, and all aspects of retail leasing, investment, and land sales. Ian’s scrupulous and driven mindset help provide his clients the smoothest transition from prospecting sites to opening stores. From mom and pop shops to corporate clients, Ian provides focus and detail to ensure each client is getting the best service they can seek.

Ian has been given the opportunity to work with tenants such as 7Leaves Tea & Coffee, Big Brand Tire Service, Capelli Salon, Cheba Hut, Chop Stop, Crave Cookies, Dominos, Freed’s Bakery, Handel’s Ice Cream, Houston’s Hot Chicken, Hummus Bowls & Wraps, KFC, Lazy Dogs Restaurants, Mission BBQ, Norms Diner, Popeyes, Quick Quack Car Wash, Randy’s Donuts, Round Table Pizza, Salad & Go, Sorry Not Sorry Creamery, The Source Dispensary, TREK Bikes, Veterinary Emergency Group, and more.

From a Landlord side, Ian has had the opportunity to work with 3D Investments, Bekam Development, CNA Enterprises, Osprey Real Estate Capital, PBC USA, Remington Nevada, Southern Land Company, Vestar, York Enterprises, and more.

Ian is dedicated to having a successful career and enjoys building and maintaining relationships with clients, other brokers, and industry professionals. He is an active member of International Council of Shopping Centers (ICSC), Certified Commercial Investment Member (CCIM). When not working, he enjoys playing hockey, snowboarding, traveling, and spending time on a boat.

address: 9435 S Rainbow Blvd7,334 SF Retail
description:
Discover a rare opportunity to own a fully leased, highly visible, multi-tenant retail property at 9435 South Rainbow Boulevard in Las Vegas, Nevada. This modern 7,334-square-foot building is 100 percent occupied by two strong, nationally recognized tenants: Broken Yolk Café, with a lease in place until 2033, and The Greek Gyro, with a lease in place until 2035. Providing long-term stability and an instant, reliable income stream. Both tenants operate under triple-net (NNN) leases, ensuring minimal landlord responsibilities and consistent cash flow. 
  
9435 South Rainbow Boulevard is strategically located just fifteen minutes from the Las Vegas Strip. This property is situated in a high-traffic retail corridor, anchored by Walmart, and offers excellent street frontage, ample parking, and superior visibility. The building boasts contemporary architecture, expansive glass storefronts, and enhanced tenant improvements, making it an attractive destination for both customers and businesses.
  
This investment benefits from the explosive growth of Southwest Las Vegas near the master-planned community of Mountain’s Edge, which spans 3,500 acres and continues to drive residential and commercial development. The surrounding area boasts a population of over 505,000 residents, generating more than $6.3 billion in annual consumer spending. With easy access to Interstate 15, Interstate 95, and the 215 Beltway, this location offers unmatched connectivity and convenience.
      
9435 South Rainbow Boulevard's prime location, strong tenant mix, and modern design make it an ideal choice for investors seeking a quality triple-net-leased retail asset in one of Las Vegas’ fastest-growing areas. This is a perfect 1031 exchange property offering ease of management, pride of ownership, and long-term income stability. Don’t miss a chance to secure a property that combines modern design, prime location, and steady rental income in a thriving market.

brokerDetails.name: Andrea Santanna
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in Retail Sales and Leasing
brokerDetails.bio:
Andrea Santanna is known as one of the most active and high profile real estate brokers in the retail sector for Southern Nevada.

Since joining Dapper Companies in 2006, Andrea has represented the company in identifying, marketing and executing retail leasing strategies that drive asset value and enhance the short-term and long-term value of clients’ real estate investments.

As a celebrated expert in the industry for her ability to identify and forecast trends in retail, she has developed an impeccable track record of leasing to first-time business owners, national brands and everything in between.

With Dapper Companies, Andrea handles all acquisitions and dispositions of the properties, in addition to handling tenants interested in leasing space in current and upcoming developments. Working with attorneys on lease, purchase and sales agreements, she is highly experienced in dealing with complex negotiations resulting in closing the deal. Andrea leads all marketing efforts for the properties, whether for lease or sale.

Andrea’s knowledge of the Southern Nevada market, in addition to her mission of creating lasting relationships with her clients, has catapulted her to top broker status in the market.

Andrea was previously a member of the commercial leasing team at NAI Horizon, assisting in the research of raw land, in addition to the leasing and sales of existing office buildings.

Andrea is a member of the International Council of Shopping Centers (ICSC). She is proud to have been born and raised in fabulous Las Vegas, where she has resided throughout her life.

address: 15 Properties
description:
This 17-property portfolio offers investors the opportunity to expand their holdings by purchasing individual locations, select groupings of similar properties, or the entire portfolio. This nationwide property offering is facilitated by NEWAMCO.ORG. The seller group aims to divest certain assets to realign its portfolio towards targeted sectors.
  
The properties in this portfolio range from a 2,575-square-foot former Taco Bell to a former 55,000-square-foot big-box Academy Sports and development land, showcasing a diverse array of assets. The built property types include former CVS Pharmacy and Pep Boys automotive repair buildings, complemented by two big-box stores and two restaurants. Each property is freestanding, standalone, and vacant and benefits from flexible zoning and not being part of other shopping centers, thus offering maximum versatility. Certain properties feature unique attributes such as drive-thrus, restaurant equipment, and drive-in doors, which enhance their adaptability for various future uses. In addition, the micro-locational benefits make them attractive to a wide range of buyers, with the corresponding cities and markets performing exceptionally well. The larger acreage commercial tracts boast excellent frontage along strong retail corridors with new developments coming around them. Two strongly positioned land parcels present dynamic development opportunities.

The wide blend of property offerings presents ample 1031 READY exchange options in price, geography and industry sector opportunities.
  
The markets surrounding each property show solid signs for successful investments, supported by multifaceted economies that promote diverse uses. More than half of the properties are located on hard corners, and some are in designated opportunity zones. 
  
For more information, please refer to the attached documents and contact Randall Perry at 727-755-3249.

address: 4605 S Las Vegas Blvd40 Room Hotel
description:
The Diamond Inn Motel, a historic property rich in legacy and limitless potential, is iconic Las Vegas Strip real estate. Situated on 1.36 acres of premium commercial lot with 237 feet of direct frontage on South Las Vegas Boulevard, this high-visibility site is just steps from the world-famous Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas sign, seen by over 45 million annual visitors. Strategically positioned only 3 miles from Harry Reid International Airport and offering immediate access to Interstate 15, the property ensures seamless connectivity for both local and international travelers. It is also just a half-mile from Allegiant Stadium, home of the Las Vegas Raiders and host of the 2024 Super Bowl, making it a prime location for sports tourism development and entertainment ventures.
  
With its 48-room layout and nostalgic pink elephant statue, the property offers a unique blend of historic charm and redevelopment potential. The Diamond Inn Motel is zoned H-1 Commercial Resort, making it ideal for a luxury hotel, high-rise development, casino resort, or entertainment complex. Located in one of the fastest-growing metro areas in the United States—the Henderson-Paradise-Las Vegas region—the population is projected to nearly double by 2060, driving demand for hospitality, retail, and entertainment infrastructure. The area is also experiencing major corporate expansion from industry leaders such as Tesla, Amazon, Apple, Switch, and Haas Automation, further boosting its economic vitality.
  
Consumer spending in the immediate vicinity is staggering. Within a 5-mile radius, the annual expenses exceed $5 billion on food and alcohol and $2.5 billion on entertainment and hobbies. This spending is fueled by the area's high visitor count and traffic volume, with over 50,000 vehicles passing daily on South Las Vegas Boulevard.

The Diamond Inn Motel presents a rare development opportunity in the heart of Las Vegas’ booming hospitality and entertainment corridor. Suited for a visionary developer, a hospitality brand, or a commercial investor, this property offers unmatched potential to create a skyline-defining project in one of the world’s most dynamic real estate markets.

brokerDetails.tagLine: J. Craig King, a fourth generation member of the King family, has served as President and CEO of J. P. King Auction Company since 1986.
brokerDetails.bio:
J. P. King Auction Company is the most experienced real estate auction company in the United States. J. P. King, Sr. founded the company in 1915, and for over a century, members of the King family have owned and continuously operated J. P. King Auction Company.
 
 Under his leadership and expertise, the company has grown from a strong regional firm to a powerful, nationwide marketing company on the leading edge of the auction industry.
 
Today, J. P. King Auction Company maintains its position as a leader in the industry by combining its unparalleled experience with a high level of integrity and professionalism. Buyers and sellers alike expect and receive a high level of service from the company. In order to serve clients better, J. P. King Auction Company continually works to improve all aspects of the auction process.

address: 3007 W Horizon Ridge Pky22,254 SF Office
description:
Secure a high-quality asset in a flourishing part of the Las Vegas metro by acquiring Horizon Medical Plaza, 3007 W Horizon Ridge Parkway, in Henderson, Nevada. This striking property spans 22,254 square feet across two stories and recently underwent over $800,000 in renovations, which upgraded the common areas, HVAC, and more. The lobby has a dramatic steel-and-wire staircase, tiled accent walls, glass partition front doors, and canister lighting. In addition, this building features 4-foot by 2-foot marble tile and bright window lines. This is an excellent value-add or owner/user opportunity with few vacancies and established medical tenants like CPL Labs, eNational Testing, and US Drug Test Centers providing immediate income.
 
Situated on 1.51 acres along a bustling thoroughfare, Horizon Medical Plaza benefits from impressive traffic counts of 14,000 vehicles per day along W Horizon Ridge Parkway. This is a well-known medical area as Horizon Medical Plaza is less than 1 mile east of Dignity Health St. Rose Dominican Hospital and Medical Center's Siena campus, with approximately 326 hospital beds. This building is strategically located in a predominant medical hub servicing the City of Henderson, surrounded by several national, regional, and local health care providers, including Southwest Medical, Comprehensive Therapy Centers, Clinical Pathology Labs, and Encompass Health Rehabilitation. Henderson’s population has been in an unprecedented growth period, and the residents are highly affluent and prioritize health and wellness, underpinning the value of medical office assets in the area.

brokerDetails.name: James Griffis
brokerDetails.tagLine: Capital Market Group
brokerDetails.bio:
Located in Las Vegas, Nevada, James is a Principal/Shareholder with Avison Young and represents a wide range of office and industrial clients consisting of investors and property owners in the California and Las Vegas market, both at regional and national levels. James co-leads the Avison Young Investment Properties team responsible for the sale, recapitalization and 1031 Exchange advisory services on behalf of high net worth and institutional clients. The team focuses on all aspects of investment sales, user sales, and development from business parks, office buildings, and industrial parks.

James has diverse experience which covers a wide range of properties and deal sizes, ranging from $5 million to $200 million.

brokerDetails.name: Joe Leavitt
brokerDetails.tagLine: Specializing in Industrial, Investment Sales & Leasing and Capital Market Groups
brokerDetails.bio:
For over 18 years Joe Leavitt has been a leader in the Commercial Real Estate industry in Nevada.  You may know him from his time at Lee & Associates from 2004-2013 and can be credited with becoming a Shareholder in 2011.  

He currently represents numerous clients specializing in the following, Capital Markets, development companies building ground up construction, property assemblages, business relocations involving tenant or buyer representation. He also represents many landlords with leasing their commercial real estate.  

Past clients include the likes of American Homes for Rent (AMH), Lexus of Las Vegas, Rebel Oil Company, Dermody Properties and many more.

Joe began his commercial real estate career in 2004 at the age of 20 while attending the University of Nevada, Las Vegas full-time, pursuing his degree in business management and real estate. Prior to joining Avison Young, Joe was a Vice President, Shareholder, and Partner of the Las Vegas office of Lee & Associates. Joe joined Avison Young in 2013 and nn 2018 was promoted to Principal.

brokerDetails.name: Chris Lexis, SIOR
brokerDetails.tagLine: Las Vegas
brokerDetails.bio:
Chris Lexis is a Principal and Shareholder at Avison Young. As a native of Las Vegas, he uses his extensive market knowledge and industry relationships to make sure clients achieve their objectives in this unique market. His integrity, work ethic and motto of “always be available”, has earned him an unwavering and loyal client base. Chris specializes in investment properties, land, and commercial and industrial development sales and leasing.

Chris started his career in 2004 at Lee & Associates where he soon became the youngest broker in the office to hold the title of Vice President and Principal. In March of 2013, Chris joined Avison Young as a Vice President of Capital Markets and quickly became Principal and Shareholder.

Chris represents property owners, investors, buyers and tenants and currently markets a number of projects in the valley. Lexis has expertise and experience when it comes to land use, planning and zoning within all of the Vegas valley’s municipalities.

In his free time (if you call it that) he’s busy keeping up with his wife, chasing down his 3-year-old daughter and taking care of his brand new baby boy. Chris has also gained first hand knowledge of owning, managing and growing a personal and family commercial real estate portfolio across 3 states.

description:
Unlock the opportunity to acquire three strategically located development parcels in the booming Las Vegas Valley, each offering exceptional visibility, accessibility, and long-term investment upside. These sites are positioned within high-growth corridors surrounded by major commercial, industrial, and residential developments, making them ideal for mixed-use, commercial, resort, or industrial projects.
  
The first site is a ±52-acre Commercial Resort-zoned landed comprised of APNs 191-05-502-002, 191-05-502-003, 191-05-501-003, 191-05-501-005, 191-05-501-009, 191-05-501-010, 191-05-503-002; located directly on Las Vegas Boulevard at the high-traffic Starr Interchange on Las Vegas Boulevard. This land is at the heart of South Las Vegas’s next wave of expansion and is surrounded by transformative developments, including Mosaic Companies’ $800 million West Henderson mixed-use project, the Las Vegas Raiders’ 50-acre headquarters, Henderson Executive Airport, Amazon’s 600,000-square-foot distribution center, and HAAS Automation’s +2 million-square-foot manufacturing campus. With utilities available and in-place zoning for resort and entertainment mixed-use, this site offers unmatched potential for large-scale commercial or hospitality development.
  
The second lot of land, APN# 126-01-302-003, is a 2.11-acre parcel at the southeast corner of Kyle Canyon Road and the future Sheep Mountain Parkway Freeway. This site offers direct frontage on Kyle Canyon Road and is less than a mile from the planned Station Casinos and future commercial center at Iron Mountain Road and Skye Village Road. With immediate access to US 95 and proximity to major future transportation corridors, this parcel is ideally suited for commercial, mixed-use, or investment purposes. The area is experiencing rapid residential growth, and the property’s location next to the planned Sheep Mountain Parkway enhances its long-term value and development flexibility.
  
The third lot includes APNs 191-17-701-015, 016, and 017, located approximately 1 mile south of the M Resort and less than 2 miles from the HAAS Automation campus. This site features extensive frontage on Las Vegas Boulevard and Via Nobila, a major new roadway connecting Las Vegas Boulevard to the Inspirada Master-Planned Community and Interstate 15. The property will also benefit from direct frontage on the planned Interstate 15 interchange at Via Nobila, positioning it as a gateway to West Henderson. This site presents a rare opportunity to develop a commercial center in one of Las Vegas’s most active submarkets, surrounded by residential communities from Lennar, KB Home, Toll Brothers, and DR Horton, as well as major commercial anchors including the proposed Stations Casino, Henderson Executive Airport, and Amazon’s distribution hub.
  
Together, these three properties represent a unique portfolio of development-ready land in Las Vegas’s most dynamic growth areas. Whether for commercial, resort, mixed-use, or industrial development, these sites offer exceptional access, zoning flexibility, and proximity to key infrastructure and employment centers, making them ideal for visionary investors and developers seeking scale and strategic positioning in Southern Nevada.

description:
3655 E. Post Road is located in the desirable Airport submarket and offers a rare, freestanding industrial opportunity with yard and dock loading, totaling ±13,891 SF. The property features ±1,493 SF of functional office space and ±12,398 SF of warehouse space, providing an efficient, versatile layout for a wide range of industrial users. The warehouse is equipped with one (1) dock-high loading door and one (1) grade-level door to accommodate flexible shipping and receiving operations. A private, attached yard further enhances the site, offering secure outdoor storage and/or additional parking.

The property is located in the Airport submarket near key arterials, providing strong connectivity for distribution and service users. The site offers convenient access to I-15, I-215, and US-95, with quick routes to Sunset Road, Russell Road, Tropicana Avenue, and other primary corridors serving the central valley and resort corridor. The building is approximately a 7-minute drive (±2.7 miles) from Harry Reid International Airport, and the Las Vegas Strip is just beyond the airport area, making the location ideal for businesses needing proximity to air cargo, hospitality, and regional freeway networks.

description:
Located within the Eastern Avenue corridor, 1204 S Eastern Ave presents a unique opportunity to acquire a functional, church property with strong adaptive-reuse potential. The site currently operates as a place of worship and is well-suited for continued religious use, community services, nonprofit organizations, office use or select redevelopment concepts, subject to zoning and approvals.

The building features a flexible interior layout with a main sanctuary, gathering areas, and supporting rooms that can accommodate classrooms, offices, or meeting spaces. The configuration allows for efficient re-programming for alternative uses such as community center, social services facility, counseling offices, or creative/assembly space.

Positioned minutes from Downtown Las Vegas and surrounded by established residential neighborhoods, the property benefits from excellent visibility, convenient access, and proximity to major thoroughfares including Eastern Avenue, Charleston Boulevard, and Interstate 515. On-site parking and street frontage further enhance usability for congregational or public-facing operations.

This offering is ideal for owner-users seeking a centrally located facility, faith-based organizations looking to expand or relocate, or investors pursuing value-add or mission-driven redevelopment opportunities in an urban infill location within Las Vegas.

spaces.description:
This 1,559 sq. ft. commercial suite, located at 52 N Pecos Rd in Henderson, Nevada, offers a unique blend of office features. The space is comprised of reception area, waiting room, five private offices, one bathroom, and a breakroom.

The interior showcases a modern design with drop ceilings, recessed lighting, and a mix of carpeted and tiled flooring. Large windows in several rooms provide ample natural light and views of the surrounding area. The bathroom is outfitted with white tiled walls, accessibility features, and modern fixtures.

A standout feature is the reception area, which includes a sleek, curved desk and tiled flooring, creating a professional first impression. Built-in shelving and custom cabinetry in some rooms offer practical storage solutions. The space also includes a kitchenette area with built-in countertops and cabinets.

The versatile layout allows for various configurations, making it suitable for a wide range of business needs. With its combination of private and open areas, this suite provides an adaptable environment for offices, medical practices, or mixed-use purposes. The property's location in Henderson offers convenience and accessibility for both clients and employees.

description:
https://www.BuyLasVegasApartmentBuildings.com/304-Maryland

Every so often, a property hits the market that feels less like a listing and more like an opportunity—one of those “if you know, you know” moments that serious investors recognize instantly.

This brand-new 12-unit multifamily building sits in the center of Prime Downtown Las Vegas, surrounded by growth, energy, and long-term demand. And now, after a recent $250,000 price adjustment and a motivated seller willing to offer owner financing with $1,000,000 down, this asset just became one of the most compelling buys in the entire market.

Below Replacement Cost—Instant Value from Day One.
You couldn’t build this property today for anywhere near the asking price. Rising construction costs make this offering a uniquely rare chance to secure new construction for less than its rebuild value—creating immediate value and long-term insulation from inflation.

Prime Downtown Location—In the Direct Path of Las Vegas Growth
Downtown Las Vegas continues to surge with redevelopment, new projects, new restaurants, new employers, and steady population inflow. Properties in this pocket are positioned for long-term appreciation, strong occupancy, and consistent demand.

To review complete financials, pro formas, and additional property information, visit the dedicated property website https://www.BuyLasVegasApartmentBuildings.com/304-Maryland
Or, to discuss this offering directly, call Paul Macaluso today for more details and to explore acquisition options.

description:
Colliers is pleased to exclusively offer for sale a new construction single-tenant net-leased Costa Vida located in Las Vegas, NV. The property consists of a ±2,900 SF freestanding building with double drive-thru and benefits from a 15-Year Absolute NNN Lease with a corporate guaranty.

This newly constructed Costa Vida Fresh Mexican Grill is well positioned at a high traffic signalized intersection along E. Flamingo Rd. and University Center Dr., with traffic counts exceeding ±69,900 VPD. Situated just minutes from the Las Vegas Strip, Harry Reid International Airport, and the University of Nevada Las Vegas (UNLV), this high profile site benefits from strong traffic, excellent visibility, and seamless access to major transportation corridors.

Surrounded by dense residential and commercial developments, the trade area boasts a population of ±413,005 residents within a 5-mile radius, with household incomes averaging $77,593. The property is positioned within a high-demand corridor featuring national retailers, dining establishments, and entertainment venues. With close proximity to Hughes Center’s 1.5MM SF of Class A office space, MSG Sphere, Formula 1 Headquarters, Las Vegas Convention Center, Vegas Loop transportation, and multiple hospitality assets, the site enjoys a dynamic mix of local consumers, professionals, and tourists – providing unparalleled access to a thriving customer base in one of the fastest-growing markets in the country.

description:
Property Description
Turnkey, Profitable Airbnb Business & Real Estate for Sale – Fabulous Las Vegas

This is a rare opportunity to acquire a high-performing, income-producing Airbnb business along with the underlying real estate in one of the most visited cities in the world — Las Vegas, Nevada.

Unlike a typical rental property, this is a fully systemized, cash-flowing short-term rental operation with established revenue, repeat guests, and strong year-round demand driven by tourism, conventions, concerts, and sporting events.

Financial & Investment Highlights:
• Consistent monthly income with documented revenue history
• Higher nightly rates and returns than long-term rentals
• Strong occupancy driven by Vegas tourism, events & conventions
• Premium pricing potential during peak seasons & major events
• Low operational overhead with streamlined systems in place
• Scalable model – perfect for expanding into multiple units
• Potential for owner-operator to increase net profit further
• Depreciation, expense write-offs, and tax advantages available

This property is already optimized for maximum profitability through:
• Professional interior design that boosts nightly rates
• High guest ratings driving repeat bookings and premium pricing
• Automated systems for messaging, check-in and pricing
• Reliable cleaning & maintenance team in place
• Optimized listing with strong SEO and professional photography

description:
Centennial Advisers is pleased to present the Tod Motor Inn, a 41-room hotel opportunity offered at $9,000,000, or an attractive $219,512 per room. This asset is 
strategically located on Las Vegas Boulevard, placing it directly in the path of The Arts District’s rapid cultural and economic transformation, offering investors a prime 
position in a dynamic redevelopment corridor.

The property presents significant revenue potential, with pro forma analysis indicating a potential gross annual income of $854,400 by achieving market rates 
of $400 per week. Investors have the flexibility to acquire the property turnkey for immediate cash flow or as-is, allowing for a custom value-add repositioning to 
capture the area's increasingly upscale demographic.

The investment is underpinned by $150 million in recent public infrastructure spending, including the $120M Las Vegas Boulevard Improvement Project. This 
modernization effort has delivered smart city infrastructure, enhanced pedestrian access, and beautification, directly supporting long-term asset appreciation and 
increased commercial viability for the entire district.

The Tod Motor Inn represents a rare opportunity to acquire a hospitality asset poised to benefit from an emerging entertainment ecosystem, including new venues like 
Atomic Golf. This property offers investors exposure to Las Vegas's most authentic district with significant upside through renovation and strategic management, 
capitalizing on unprecedented local investment.

description:
Owner-User Opportunity in the Southwest Las Vegas Submarket with In-Place Income and Building and Monument Signage
 
—	CORPORATE USER OPPORTUNITY | This is an ideal corporate headquarter investment that provides an attractive lease-saving trade-off. The purchase provides protection against future rental market uncertainty and rate hikes.
 
—
 	OWNER-USER OFFICE OFFERING | Located in the Southwest Las Vegas Submarket 8879 W. Flamingo is situated approximately 1 mile from the CC-215 which offers efficient connectivity to the Las Vegas Valley.
 
—	BELOW MARKET RENTS | Current in-place rents are 41% below market; three tenants are MTM allowing a new owner to immediately bring these spaces to market rent. The fourth tenant expires December 31, 2026; beginning January 1, 2027, a new owner can lease up these spaces at current market rates.
 
—	FLEXIBLE OWNER-USER OCCUPANCY | The property offers an owner-user to the option to immediately occupy up to ±3,230 SF (across the first and second floor). Effective January 1, 2027, the new owner will have the option to occupy the entire building.
 
Unrivaled Amenity-Rich Location in Southwest Las Vegas
 
—	CONNECTIVITY AND CONVENIENT COMMUTE. Located approximately 1-mile to the CC-215 at the Flamingo interchange this owner user opportunity provides superior regional connectivity and convenient commute for Las Vegas, Sky Canyon, and Henderson residents.
 
—	LOW VACANCY. The Southwest Las Vegas submarket enjoys the lowest total vacancy rate at 6.4% and the second highest lease rate in Southern Nevada at $3.02 / SF / Month FSG.
 
—	PRIME LOCATION WITH EXTENSIVE AMENITIES. W. Flamingo is an established office/retail corridor with proximity to nearby amenities. Within a 3-mile radius there are 150+ restaurant options, a population of ±177,666, and an average household income of $118,832.

LINK TO OM: https://logiccre.com/1031_properties/950-grier-dr-suite-a-las-vegas/
950 Grier Dr, Suite A is a single-story flex office and warehouse condo totaling ±13,875 SF situated within the Hughes Airport Center master-planned business park, adjacent to Harry Reid International Airport. Ownership is currently in the process of subdividing the building into two condo parcels, with this offering representing the vacant west portion of the Property. The space includes a ±1,585 SF (11%) warehouse area featuring an 18'3" clear height and one grade-level door measuring 12'3" x 15'2", providing excellent functionality for light industrial or distribution use. The balance of the space is improved area suitable for a range of professional or service-oriented users. The adjacent east portion (Suite B) is fully occupied by Cirque du Soleil, who recently executed a y-year early lease extension through March 2033. The Property offers convenient access to Interstate 15, Interstate 215, and the Las Vegas Strip, providing excellent connectivity throughout the greater Las Vegas area. Originally constructed in 1989, the building benefits from its strategic airport-adjacent location.

description:
295 Sunpac Ave represents a rare opportunity to acquire a best-in-class owner-user industrial facility in one of Henderson’s most supply-constrained industrial pockets. Currently the only industrial property available for sale in the immediate area, the building distinguishes itself through a level of finish, infrastructure, and site utility that is rarely found in comparable assets.

The property has been intentionally designed and extensively modernized with a clear understanding of how modern industrial businesses operate. Office, executive, visitor, and production functions are purposefully separated, allowing each use to function efficiently without overlap. The office environment provides a professional setting for meetings, sales, and administrative operations, while the shop floor is supported by its own dedicated offices and restrooms—creating a facility that accommodates both executive and trade functions without compromise.

Upstairs offices offer direct shop-floor visibility on one side for operational oversight and mountain views on the other, reinforcing the building’s dual focus on performance and presence. High-speed Cox Fiber has been delivered directly to the building, ensuring the data infrastructure aligns with its modern, high-tech design and operational requirements.

The site offers a rare combination of secured yard space and on-site parking, an increasingly scarce advantage in this submarket where parking is limited. With hard-corner frontage and visibility at Sunpac Ave and Haren, this asset is purpose-built for an owner-user seeking long-term control in a market where quality industrial inventory remains exceptionally tight.

Building Specifications:   The property includes four (4) grade-level roll-up doors measuring approximately 14 feet high by 12 feet wide, with warehouse clear heights of approximately 20 feet 1 inch and ±21 feet 9 inches to deck. Office ceiling heights are approximately 8 feet. The building is fully fire-sprinklered and equipped with 600-amp, 3-phase power. The layout includes three (3) total restrooms, with separate facilities serving office and shop areas.

High-image fully remodeled two-story office building in the heart of Las Vegas’ dominant Southwest submarket with immediate lease-up and long-term upside.

Positioned at the signalized hard corner of Decatur and Harmon, minutes from the Strip, I-15, CC-215, and Harry Reid International Airport, Skyview Business Park provides excellent visibility, strong traffic counts, and convenient access for both employees and clients. The 49,833 SF Class B asset underwent a comprehensive renovation.
The property is currently leased to a mix of professional and technology tenants leasing approx 54% OF THE BUILDING with two remaining suites actively marketed at 1.35 per SF NNN plus 0.38 NNN CAM

description:
Colliers is pleased to exclusively offer for sale a new construction two-tenant retail building located in Las Vegas, NV. This stabilized property consists of ±7,926 SF and is NNN leased to a doggie daycare, boarding, and grooming facility and a liquor store.

The asset is well positioned within the high growth Southwest trade area of Las Vegas, Nevada, at the signalized intersection of W. Cactus Ave. and S. Rainbow Blvd., with traffic counts in excess of ±41,700 VPD. Cactus Shops benefits from its proximity to both the I-15 Freeway (±156,000 VPD) and CC 215 Beltway (±211,000 VPD) and is in proximity to major planned developments including a future Station Casino’s hotel/resort/casino (±126 AC) and a future HCA Hospital (±57 AC) at Cactus Ave. and Las Vegas Blvd. National co-tenants within in the center include Chevron, Meineke, and Don Tortaco.

The asset services a dense and mature trade area consisting of ±247,840 residents with an average annual household income of ±$137,121 within a 5-mile radius. The property is located within the Mountain’s Edge master planned community (±12,500 homes on ±3,500 AC) and is surrounded by affluent residential neighborhoods, including Southern Highlands.

description: This offering features a brand-new 20-year absolute NNN ground lease with McDonald’s Corporation (NYSE: MCD), the world’s largest quick-service restaurant brand with over 40,000 locations globally. The lease provides passive, long-term income backed by McDonald’s investment-grade credit (S&P: BBB+), with zero landlord responsibilities. McDonald’s has a proven track record of performance through economic cycles, bolstered by resilient cash flows, substantial liquidity, and operational efficiency—particularly in high-volume, off-premise formats. The property features McDonald’s newest-generation, drive-thru only prototype, purpose-built to meet evolving consumer preferences for convenience and speed. Strategically located at the primary signalized entrance to Valley Vista, a 2,600-acre master-planned community by D.R. Horton with 4,100 homes, the asset benefits from affluent surrounding demographics with 1-mile household incomes exceeding $115,000. This location represents the final pad available for sale within a newly constructed shopping center, underscoring the high barriers to entry created by limited retail development opportunities, built-out residential corridors, and restrictive land use policies. The northern submarket continues to demonstrate strong fundamentals, including declining vacancy rates and accelerated leasing velocity, further supporting long-term value preservation. Additionally, Nevada’s status as an income tax-free state enhances after-tax yields for investors.

description:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Centennial Advisers presents The Barrister Building, an exceptional value-add acquisition opportunity located in the heart of Las Vegas’ most prestigious legal
corridor. This 6,800 SF mixed-use property at 325 S. 3rd Street is 100% vacant, offering unmatched f|exibility for owner-users and investors alike. The two-story
structure features 4,600 SF of leasable space across 13 f|exible suites, providing the perfect opportunity for law {rms or professionals seeking a presence in Las Vegas’
thriving legal hub.

The property’s prime location, directly across from the Las Vegas Justice Court and within walking distance of the Regional Justice Center, Clark County Government
Center, and other major government buildings, offers unparalleled convenience for law firms and legal professionals. The building’s corner exposure on S. 3rd Street and
Lewis Avenue ensures exceptional brand visibility and high foot traffic from attorneys, clients, and court personnel daily.

The property is offered at $2,600,000, with a price per SF of $371. This presents an excellent opportunity to acquire an asset in a district with limited office supply,
supported by a government employment base and strong demand from legal professionals. The proforma income potential exceeds $150,000 annually at market
rents, significantly higher than the previous rent roll of $100,260.

This vacant condition allows for immediate customization without tenant negotiations or buyouts, making it ideal for owner-users looking to design their ideal
legal office or investors seeking to reposition the property to market rates. The Barrister Building provides complete f|exibility to reconfigure space, create signature
office environments, and capitalize on its strategic location in the Downtown Las Vegas redevelopment district.

description:
Rare ±4.14-acre infill industrial parcel zoned M-2 (Industrial Heavy) – Clark County’s most permissive industrial designation. M-2/IH district allows virtually every heavy industrial use by right, including manufacturing, metal fabrication, chemical processing and storage, concrete/asphalt batch plants, truck terminals, salvage and recycling operations, large-scale warehousing/distribution, outdoor storage, and resource extraction – providing unmatched development flexibility for end-users, developers, and investors.
Strategically positioned with direct frontage on Hollywood Blvd and less than one mile from the full-diamond I-15 interchange at Speedway Blvd (Craig Road corridor), the site offers immediate access to the entire Las Vegas Valley, Harry Reid International Airport (20 minutes), and the greater Southwest logistics network. Surrounded by established industrial operators in the North Las Vegas/Speedway industrial submarket, the parcel benefits from excellent visibility, all utilities to site, and a level topography ready for vertical development.

Key Highlights
±4.14 gross acres (±180,338 SF)
Zoning: M-2/IH (Industrial Heavy)
Unparalleled use permissions – heaviest zoning available
under 1 mile to I-15 via Speedway Blvd interchange
Flat and fenced
All utilities at or adjacent to property line
Strong industrial corridor with rising land values

An exceptional opportunity to acquire one of the few remaining M-2/IH infill sites in the North Las Vegas industrial core, perfectly suited for owner-users requiring maximum operational flexibility or developers seeking a high-demand, build-ready parcel in a supply-constrained market. 

All information contained herein is believed to be accurate but is not guaranteed; prospective purchasers are advised to independently verify all data and conduct their own due diligence.

lotDetails.description:
The subject property is a ±5,000 square foot multi-tenant retail center situated on approximately 0.37 acres, constructed in 2004. Strategically positioned in Southwest Las Vegas, the asset benefits from exceptional visibility along West Flamingo Road—one of the city's most heavily trafficked thoroughfares—with direct frontage exposure to over 38,000 vehicles per day. The site is located less than a quarter mile from the intersection of West Flamingo Road and South Fort Apache Road, and under half a mile from Interstate 215, offering superior regional connectivity.
The property is surrounded by a robust retail corridor and is supported by strong demographic fundamentals. Within a three-mile radius, the population exceeds 152,000 residents, with an average household income of approximately $82,000 annually. This affluent and densely populated trade area enhances the property's appeal to both national and local tenants.
Nearby national retailers include Starbucks, Smith’s, Kohl’s, Sears, The Home Depot, The UPS Store, Life Storage, and Egg Works, contributing to the area’s established retail synergy and consumer draw. The combination of high traffic counts, strong demographics, and proximity to major retail anchors positions the subject property as a compelling investment opportunity in the Las Vegas retail market.
